Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We can decide a set of constraints that reflects typical order flow: RO -> CA -> RI -> PI -> QC -> PO -> GSL -> D. Then Invoice Customer (IC) and Record Payment (RP) maybe happen after dispatch but could be parallel. Provide bounds: maybe each activity occurs exactly once per case

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Always_before: If the first activity occurs, then the second activity should have been executed previously. That means second must be before first. So when first occurs, second must have been executed earlier in that case. So second must be before first. Thus for always_before, we need pairs (first, second) where second must have been executed before first. So represent as (A, B) meaning A can occur only if B has already occurred

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: always_after: If first activity occurs, then second activity is executed in one of the following events. That means second must occur after first. So pair (first, second) where second must happen after first

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: always_before set includes tuples where first is later activity, second is earlier predecessor. Always_after pairs are (earlier, later). So include (PI,RI), (QC,PI) etc for always_before, (RI,PI), (PI,QC) etc for always_after

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Make sure syntax correct: sets of tuples. Thus final answer should be code block with dictionary. Lets craft log_skeleton = { ... }
